title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Sulzer opens GBS Hub in Pune, India
items.summary: - Sulzer inaugurates a *Global Business Services Hub* in Pune, expanding its engineering footprint in India and integrating IT, Legal, Compliance and Supply Chain functions.\n- The Pune hub will support Sulzer's global operations with a capacity of *350 people*, leveraging India's talent pool, modern infrastructure and strategic location.\n- Sulzer's *191-year* engineering heritage underscores its commitment to sustainability, enabling energy efficiency and reduced carbon emissions through the expanded network.

items.title: Govt to modernise SCL Mohali with ₹4,500 cr investment: Ashwini Vaishnaw
ESDS launches Nvidia/AMD sovereign GPU service for AI
items.author: ETTelecom Desk
items.summary:
- **NVIDIA** and **AMD** powered **GPU-as-a-Service** to support **AI/ML**, *generative AI* and *LLM* development across enterprises and government sectors.
- The launch leverages **NVIDIA DGX/HGX** architectures and **AMD MI300X** platforms to train massive models, accelerate inference and manage large-scale data workloads.
- **GPU SuperPODs** feature high-bandwidth **NVLink**, unified memory pools, intelligent scheduling and AI-optimized orchestration to democratize access for enterprises and research bodies.

items.title: Waaree bags 350 MW AMPIN order
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - **Waaree Energies** secured a **350 MW** solar module supply order from **AMPIN Energy Transition** for projects across multiple locations in India.\n- The **G12R TOPCon** modules offer higher energy density, bifaciality, and improved low-light performance for utility-scale and C&I developers.\n- Deliveries are scheduled to be completed by **March 2026**, with an estimated CO₂ displacement of about *407,000 tonnes* annually.

items.title: Govt to open nuclear sector to private players: Modi
items.author: Surendra Singh
items.summary:
- PM Modi announced the government is moving to open India's nuclear sector to *private investments*, mirroring the space sector opening.
- The reforms will enable private participation in *small modular reactors*, *nuclear innovation*, boosting *energy security*.
- This comes ahead of the *Atomic Energy Bill 2025* and **CLNDA** amendments, with a target of 100 GW by 2047.

items.title: ENGIE secures 280 MW battery storage project in Gujarat, marking its first BESS contract in India
FDA flags India-made cookware for potential lead leaching
items.summary:
- The **FDA** flagged several India-made cookware as potentially leaching **lead**, following an August alert that added nine products to a discard list.
- Lead exposure can cause abdominal pain, nausea, memory loss, and other health problems, with higher risk for **women of childbearing age** and breastfeeding mothers.
- The utensils, including saucepans, brass pots, kadai, and milk pots, were sold in multiple states such as **California, Illinois, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, and DC**, with retailers urged to verify safety status.

items.title: Saini confident of Tesla setting up manufacturing plant in Haryana
India needs targeted public finance to scale green steel, avoid carbon lock-in: IEEFA
Envision Group mulls India battery plant to boost storage
items.summary:
- **Envision Group** is weighing a **5 GWh/year** India battery plant with a **$34 million** investment, localizing assembly and sourcing cells from China.
- The plan targets grid reliability as renewables grow, with India’s storage potential projected to about **46 GW by 2032** and a decision expected in **18 months**.
- There are concerns about **inexperienced bidders** in battery tenders and the need for strong techno-commercial capability to deliver projects.

items.title: Vedanta back in debt market, seeks ₹2,000 crore via metals arm
Dutch chip giant ASML eyes support office in GIFT City
items.author: Dia Rekhi, ETtech
items.summary:
- **ASML** is exploring a customer support office in *GIFT City*, Gujarat, to service its Indian customers.
- Executives reportedly visited *GIFT City* and signaled starting with a support office, with a potential expansion to a full **Dholera** facility as the fab progresses.
- The move aligns with India's push to attract *semiconductor* players and accompanies **Tata Electronics**'s planned fab in **Dholera**, expected to begin chip production by December 2026.

items.title: India needs targeted public finance to scale green steel, avoid carbon lock-in: IEEFA
Rare earths permanent magnets manufacturing to reduce imports: PM Modi
Haier seeks ₹1,000 cr capital boost; files Press Note 3 for India expansion
Budget 2026: India’s space sector seeks triple budget boost and a satellite mission for remote regions
NIRDC launches InDApp to streamline ease of doing business for MSMEs
Neuron Energy raises ₹31cr in Pre-Series B to scale batteries
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Neuron Energy raised *₹31 crore* in a *Pre-Series B* round led by Equanimity Ventures and family offices to boost EV battery tech.
- Funds will expand capacity to **3 GWh** and set up an automated production facility for *EVs* at *Chakan, Pune*, plus stronger *R&D* and international expansion.
- The company aims to reach about *₹200 crore* revenue this year and over *₹900 crore* in coming years, reinforcing leadership in *smart battery management*.

items.title: INOX Air Products inks nitrogen deal for ReNew Dholera plant
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- INOX Air Products signs a long-term deal to supply *ultra-high purity nitrogen* to ReNew Photovoltaics’ upcoming *TOPCon* solar cell facility at *Dholera*, Gujarat.
- A dedicated *air separation unit* will be installed in *Dholera* to provide continuous *UHP nitrogen* for the plant’s cell-manufacturing processes, targeting operation by the end of next year.
- This collaboration expands INOXAP’s on-site gas supply to ReNew and supports its shift from *PERC* to *TOPCon* production with a focus on purity and reliability.

items.title: Tesla India plant in Haryana: CM Nayab Singh
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - *Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini* says Tesla will set up its first India manufacturing plant in Haryana, as he inaugurates the all-in-one Tesla India Motors Centre in Gurugram.\n- He calls Haryana a *manufacturing powerhouse* and a hub for auto, IT and allied industries, expecting Tesla-related units beyond a factory.\n- The state highlights reforms like an industrial plots leasing policy, strengthened local supply chains, and a dedicated *Department of Foreign Cooperation* to attract foreign investment.

items.title: Global supply chain situation getting better: Safran CEO
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The global supply chain is improving and *we see light at the end of the tunnel*, says Safran CEO Olivier Andries.
- Ukraine war and raw-material shocks (*titanium*, *nickel*, *aluminium*) have strained supply chains, but recovery is under way.
- Safran opened its largest LEAP engine MRO in *Hyderabad* and plans an M88 MRO, with studies forecasting airlines' losses above *$11 billion* in 2025.

items.title: Dairy product manufacturer Ace International raises $35 million funding
Vedanta expands electric forklift fleet to 142 units
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Vedanta Aluminium expanded its lithium-ion powered **electric forklifts** fleet to 142 units across Odisha and Chhattisgarh, with 116 at the Jharsuguda smelter.
- The expansion is expected to cut about 4,450 tonnes of CO₂e annually and save 16.3 lakh litres of diesel, while improving safety and maintenance.
- It supports Vedanta's *net-zero by 2050* and 2030 decarbonisation goals, includes new roles for women and transgender workers, and deploys India's first **10-tonne** capacity electric forklifts.

items.title: TVS-BMW Motorrad cross 200k milestone
items.summary:
- **200,000-unit milestone** achieved by TVS Motor Company and BMW Motorrad in their 2013 partnership, highlighting the *sub-500cc* collaboration.
- Joint models like *G 310 R*, *G 310 GS*, and *G 310 RR* are in strong demand across Europe, the Americas, Asia and 100+ markets.
- The pair will invest in new platforms and joint *R&D* to meet evolving urban and premium mobility needs, reinforcing their legacy of *innovation* and performance.

items.title: Cyient, CNH expand autonomous equipment partnership
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Cyient and CNH Construction Equipment expanded their partnership to accelerate *perception* and *automation technologies* across multiple vehicle platforms.
- The program delivered the **Advanced Perception System** for wheel loaders, showcased at Bauma, a milestone toward autonomous construction machinery.
- Leaders from CNH and Cyient vow to co-create next-generation solutions that scale *autonomy* across segments, boosting safety, efficiency and productivity.

items.title: Tembo Global to raise Tembo Defence stake to 75%
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Tembo Global approved up to *₹126.71 crore* investment in Tembo Defence Products, lifting its stake to *75%* and making it a subsidiary.\n- The move, approved at the Board on Nov 26, 2025, strengthens Tembo’s presence in *defence manufacturing* and aligns with *national priorities* in India’s defence ecosystem.\n- MD *Sanjay J Patel* says the investment demonstrates sector confidence and aims to drive *innovation*, quality and value for stakeholders.

items.title: Safran to fully transfer engine tech to India: CEO
items.summary:
- Safran, backed by French government support, is **committed to full engine technology transfer** to *India* for the next fighter engine. 
- Andries said India would be the only country where Safran would do so, with DRDO engagement on technical and commercial co-development and Hyderabad MRO facilities for LEAP and M88 engines. 
- Safran also plans to set up a final assembly line in India for Rafale engines and critical components if orders for the fighter jets grow.

items.title: Tata Power to build 10-GW ingots & wafers plant in Odisha
items.summary: - Tata Power plans to set up a 10-GW ingots and wafers facility in Odisha with an investment of ₹10,000 crore, to *backward integrate* into solar cells and panels. - The project targets both domestic use and export markets and would leverage its existing **4.55 GW** cell-and-module capacity. - Location options include *Gopalpur* (Ganjam district) and *Cuttack*, chosen for proximity to ports.

items.title: L&T among top Nifty50 gainers after ₹4,131
items.summary: - **Larsen & Toubro** rose in early trade to about ₹4,131.3, up as much as 1.71%.\n- The rally is driven by *robust order inflows*, strong revenue growth, and a *favorable broker outlook* recommending a buy.\n- **Motilal Oswal Securities** reiterated a bullish stance citing strong fundamentals and sector tailwinds.

items.title: PM Modi unveils Vikram-I, India’s largest orbital rocket
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- PM Modi virtually launched Skyroot Aerospace's *Vikram-I*, India's first private orbital rocket, and inaugurated the Infinity Campus in Hyderabad for end-to-end development, integration, and testing of launch vehicles. 
- Vikram-I is a multi-stage launch vehicle with an all-carbon-fibre body and **3D-printed liquid engines**, capable of placing about 300 kg into *low Earth orbit*, and can be assembled and launch-ready within 24 hours from any site. 
- The PM described it as a significant leap for India’s space sector and said India will emerge as a global leader in the *satellite launch ecosystem*.

items.title: Auto industry hails Cabinet’s ₹7,280-crore push for domestic rare earth magnet manufacturing
Krutrim’s semicon team exits loom over chip plans
US group sues Apple over Congo conflict minerals
Nvidia rebuts critics in memo to analysts amid pushback campaign
Trump team wants Taiwan to train US chip plant workers
Mexico plans Latin America’s biggest supercomputer
items.summary:
- **Coatlicue**, a *public* supercomputer, will reach **314 petaflops** to aid *climate*, crop planning, water and energy projects.
- Construction starts January, lasts 24 months, at about **6 billion pesos** (~$326.6M).
- It aims to boost science and entrepreneurship, competing with exascale rivals like **El Capitan** and **Jupiter**.

items.title: Pexpo targets ₹250cr rev in FY25 on 10x growth
items.author: ETRetail Desk
items.summary: - *Pexpo* targets ₹250 crore revenue in FY25 after a six‑year 10x growth from ₹20 crore in 2020 to ₹180 crore in 2024.\n- Growth is driven by *product innovation*, *manufacturing expansion*, and rising demand for plastic alternatives.\n- The brand’s step on anti‑dumping duty against Chinese vacuum flasks supports domestic manufacturing and aligns with *Make in India* and *Aatmanirbhar Bharat*.

items.title: Andhra keen to create ecosystem for small, medium enterprise units: Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
Cosmic PV Power Ltd expands into the IPP market by securing ₹600 crore solar modules supply order from Zetwerk
Tamil Nadu signs 158 MoUs for ₹43,844 cr, inks pact for 2-seater trainer aircraft manufacturing unit
Japan unions target ¥12k monthly base pay hike next year
items.summary:
- The *Japan Council of Metalworkers' Unions* (JCM) is seeking at least *¥12,000* more in monthly base pay for next year, matching this year's target.
- The move comes as *Rengo*, Japan's largest labor confederation, calls for at least *5%* total wage rise in 2026, including a base pay increase of at least *3%*.
- According to Rengo, member unions achieved an average pay rise of *5.25%* this year, the biggest in *34 years*.

items.title: India must become a world manufacturer, say industry leaders
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- *India must become the world's manufacturing hub*, with **competitiveness** and *sustainability* driving the next phase of growth.
- Jamshyd Godrej emphasized that India has progressed but still faces a long path to become a **manufacturer to the world**.
- P. Anbalagan highlighted Maharashtra's goal of a **USD 1 trillion economy by 2030**, aiming for two-digit growth and attracting **USD 500 billion** in investment plus up to 10 million MSME units.

items.title: Alstom marks a decade at Madhepura JV; WAG-12B hits 550
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - *Alstom* marked the tenth anniversary of the Madhepura Electric Locomotive Pvt. Ltd. (MELPL) JV with more than *550* WAG-12B locomotives delivered.\n- The WAG-12B locomotives deliver *12,000 HP* and can haul *6,000 tonnes* at *120 km/h*, with depots at Saharanpur and Nagpur as support.\n- The milestone underscores a growing domestic supply chain and jobs across 21 villages in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh.

items.title: Diageo India cuts GHG 93%, surpasses renewables target
items.summary:
- **Diageo India’s United Spirits** cut greenhouse gas emissions by **93%** since 2020 and now uses **99% renewable energy**, well ahead of its **2030 target**. 
- **54%** improvement in water-use efficiency at distilleries and **35%** at packaging sites since 2020; FY25 replenished **182,000 m³** with a cumulative total of **11 lakh m³**; coal phased out in 2022 with zero waste to landfill and **99% recyclable packaging**. 
- Social impact and governance: leadership diversity toward a **50%** target, skilling **1,922** people (67% women, **303** with disabilities); outreach via Act Smart India (**2 lakh** youth) and DRINKiQ (**5 lakh**), plus Bar Academy training over **9,400** bartenders.

items.title: India's green economy may attract $4.1 trillion investments, create 48 million jobs: Study
Indrajaal launches India's first mobile anti-drone vehicle
items.summary:
- The *Indrajaal Ranger* ADPV is India’s first *mobile, AI-enabled counter-drone system* that detects, tracks and neutralises hostile drones along the borders. 
- Built on a 4×4 chassis with SkyOS autonomy, it offers up to *10 km* drone detection and up to *4 km* mitigation, backed by AI threat assessment and options like *cyber takeover*, **soft-kill**, and interceptor drones. 
- Aimed at *border security forces* and police to curb drone-based smuggling of drugs and weapons, it marks Indrajaal’s response to a new battlefield, per founder *Kiran Raju*.

items.title: Vipul Organics announces foray into membrane manufacturing, expands capacity with new Sayakha plant
Thermax TBWES wins ₹580 crore Dangote order
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *TBWES* won an order worth over ₹580 crore from **Dangote Industries** for the refinery and petrochemical complex in **Nigeria**, including four 400 TPH high‑pressure boilers.
- *TBWES* will manage project execution, engineering, procurement, manufacturing, plug‑and‑play boiler modules, and supervision of construction and commissioning.
- This marks a continued partnership with **Dangote Industries**; Thermax previously supplied boilers and HRSGs for the Lekki refinery project in 2017 and has supported installation and modernization since.

items.title: Mirana Toys raises ₹57.5 crore in Series A funding
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Series A led by *Arkam Ventures*, with *Accel*, *Info Edge* and *Riverwalk Holdings*, to fund a factory with injection-moulding, die-casting and in-house packaging to scale production.\n- Founded in 2021 by Devansh Sharma and Ravi Yadav, Mirana uses a vertically integrated model for design, electronics, tooling and assembly, with products like *AI-enabled robots* and STEM kits.\n- US exports ~40% of demand; Mirana targets growth in the Middle East and Africa as India’s tech-toys market nears $6.95B by 2034 (12.5% CAGR).

items.title: Zetwerk names Jai Shankar Krishnan as Independent Director
items.summary:
- Zetwerk names *Jai Shankar Krishnan* as an independent director to support its **global expansion**.
- Krishnan brings over three decades in **industrial manufacturing**, with roles at Hindustan Unilever, GlaxoSmithKline, Novartis and Danaher.
- Zetwerk says his experience with the **Danaher Business System** will aid **operational systems**, acquisitions and growth.
